title: Cactus Identification
description: From towering saguaros to tiny button cacti, test your knowledge of these fascinating desert survivors!

questions.question: Which iconic cactus can grow up to 40 feet tall and is a symbol of the American Southwest?
What type of cactus has flat, paddle-shaped segments and is also called "Prickly Pear"?
Which small, round cactus is covered in hooked spines and is commonly called the "Fishhook Cactus"?
The Peyote cactus is known for containing what type of substance?
Which cactus blooms only at night with large, fragrant white flowers that wilt by morning?
What is the edible fruit of the Opuntia cactus called?
Which cactus is also known as "Old Man Cactus" because of its covering of long white hairs?
The Barrel Cactus gets its name from what feature?
options: Its flowers look like barrel tops
Its bark looks like a barrel
It was used to store water in barrels

questions.question: Which popular holiday cactus has flat, segmented stems and blooms around Thanksgiving or Christmas?
What brightly colored cactus is actually two cacti grafted together, with a colorful top on a green base?
Which cactus species is farmed commercially for the production of cochineal dye?
The "Bunny Ears Cactus" is a variety of Opuntia known for what feature?
options: Pairs of oval pads that look like rabbit ears
Pink flower buds at the tips

questions.question: Which tall, columnar cactus is sometimes used as a living fence in Mexico and Central America?
What unique feature does the Astrophytum asterias (Star Cactus) have?
How does a cactus primarily perform photosynthesis since most lack traditional leaves?
